document.docTitle: Leptocera prolixofulva Buck & Marshall 2009, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of New World Leptocera Olivier (Diptera, Sphaeroceridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of New World Leptocera Olivier (Diptera, Sphaeroceridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description . Very similar to
L. fulva
, with the following differences ( Figs. 253–256 ): Posterior section of surstylus more yellowish (medium to dark brown in
L. fulva
), with long medial bristle inserted far above level of apical series of strong spines (in
L. fulva
inserted about same level as uppermost spine); series of apical spines more or less horizontally oriented (rising posteriorly in
L. fulva
); portion of surstylus between long medial bristle and series of apical spines more slender than in
L. fulva
. Postgonite ( Fig. 268 ) very similar to
L. fulva
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 246–252 .
Leptocera insularum
sp.n. (246–249: Puerto Rico, 250–252: Dominican Republic). Male terminalia (phallus and postgonites omitted): (246) lateral, cercus omitted; (247) posterior; (248) ventral, cerci omitted; (249) sternite 5. Female terminalia: (250) dorsal; (251) spermathecae; (252) ventral. ce—cercus, cda—dorsal arm of cercus, cva—ventral arm of cercus.

FIGURES 253–259 .
Leptocera prolixofulva
sp.n. (Venezuela). Male terminalia (phallus and postgonites omitted): (253) lateral; (254) posterior, right cercus omitted; (255) ventral, cerci omitted; (256) sternite 5. Female terminalia: (257) dorsal; (258) spermathecae; (259) ventral. ce—cercus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female terminalia ( Figs. 257–259 ) indistinguishable from
L. fulva
.

Etymology . The species name refers to the fact that the posterior section of the surstylus is extended between the strong medial bristle and the apical series of stout spines (Lat. prolixus : stretched out).
Distribution . Only known from Panama , Venezuela , and Ecuador west of the Andes. From sea level to 1,760 m .

Discussion . The differences between this species and
L. fulva
are mentioned in the description. The partially sympatric
L. rhadinofulva
sp.n. differs from
L. prolixofulva
sp.n. in that the bristles of the apical series of the posterior section of the surstylus are more hair-like with fine tips, and the cercus is longer (slightly longer than the posterior section of the surstylus).
